title: Definitions
context: PART X. SCRAP DEALERS Note Sections 445-231 to 445-235 designated as Part X by L 1990, c 164, §28. Assessment under §26H-4 removed. L 1992, c 232, §1. §445-231 Definitions. As used in this chapter, unless the context otherwise requires: &ldquo;Beer keg&rdquo; means a metal container used to hold five gallons or more of liquid that is stamped, engraved, stenciled, or otherwise marked with the name of a brewery manufacturer; provided that a deposit beverage container, as defined under section 342G-101, shall not be considered a beer keg. &ldquo;Copper&rdquo; means copper in all different forms, including tubing, sheets (includes plates), gutters, down spouts, bars, bare wire or cable, insulated wire or cable, and aluminum/copper coil used in air conditioning and refrigeration. &ldquo;Scrap&rdquo; means any secondhand or used metal except those used motor vehicle parts provided in chapter 289. &ldquo;Scrap dealer&rdquo; means any person engaged in the business of buying, selling, or dealing in scrap, or any person operating, carrying on, conducting, or maintaining a scrap yard. &ldquo;Scrap yard&rdquo; means any yard, plot, space, enclosure, building, or any other place where scrap is collected, stored, gathered together, and kept. &ldquo;Urn&rdquo; means a container that is or has been used to hold human ashes. [L 1976, c 230, pt of §2; am L 2007, c 197, §§1, 7; am L 2008, c 16, §20 and c 53, §§2, 6; am L 2009, c 44, §§1, 2; am L 2016, c 199, §2]
